title: What if the future age started in the Stone Age? - Quora

response.answer_text: What if the future age started in the Stone Age? Well… it’s impossible to make a prediction about this until you explain some things to us: First, what does “started in the Stone Age” even mean? Do you mean a post-apocalyptic future scenario where we’ve regressed that far in technology? If so, that’s been done to death by science fiction. Do you mean “the Stone Age was when we got a concept of past/present/future”? You’ll have to talk to a paleontologist, but humans almost certanily already had that concept during the Stone Age, and possibly even earlier - a tribe of Homo Habilis would need that concept in order to build other concepts like “the hunting grounds we seek are 2 day’s journey from here”. And we know that Neanderthals probably had a concept not only of “future” but even “afterlife” due to their use of grave goods when burying the dead. (Think about it - making a really good flint knife is a *lot* of effort, and unless you think that Ogg will still be needing it, you’re not going to bury it with Ogg - you’d swipe it because Ogg is obviously not going to ever use it again in *this* life) Or are you using it as “past/present/future doesn’t work the way we think it does”, in which case you’ll have to explain how it *does* work before we can extrapolate what that ends up doing?

Interesting question and, in my opinion, it is a very real possibility. There are so many environmental or human-created events that could very well knock humanity back into a ‘Stone Age’ condition Take your pick -Super Volcano (VEI 8 or larger) -Coronal Mass Ejection (solar flare) -Super virus -Rogue asteroid or meteorite impact -Nearby Supernova -Crop famines -Nuclear conflict The effects would be varied, based on the severity of the event. Eventually, if humans could still maintain a base population (say 10,000 breeding pairs), we should recover.
